more_info.origin: Sodium salts of tartaric acid, a natural acid present in many fruits, especially grapes. Commercially prepared from waste products of the wine industry (grape skins).
more_info.characteristics: Sodium tartarate is an acidity regulator and anti-oxidant.
more_info.products: Many products, mainly confectionery, marmalade and sausages.
more_info.side_effects: It is not metabolised in the body; thus, it is excreted in the urine without side effects.
more_info.dietary_restrictions: Tartaric acid and tartarates can normally be consumed by all religious groups, vegans and vegetarians.
